data.title: Great restaurant  in Rocklin
data.text: It was our anniversary and we wanted to go someplace special and yet stay locally so we chose to go to Rubino's. As seniors, my husband and I prefer to eat our main meal at lunch time.  We arrived about 1 o'clock and Tony our waiter seated us right away & brought out the bread and dipping oil while we looked over the menu.  We both ordered veal scallopini and it came with pasta and carrots which were thinly sliced and delicious. Because we had mentioned it was our anniversary, Tony brought us a dish of spumoni  which was just the right dessert to share at the end of a very nice meal.

data.title: Teramisu I now love you!  Seriously, let's start with the dessert.
data.text: I NEVER have been a huge fan of tiramisu.  But, I was persuaded to stay and try it tonight.  One bite led to another and THANK GOD they brought me a small piece or I would have regrets regarding my waist line later. Incredible! This evidently is the perfection that others have strove for and never achieved.  I would go back just for the tiramisu.  But, that wouldn't be the only reason to go again.  The Chicken Marsala I had was tender, full of flavor and sop your bread in the sauce Ah-MAZ-ZING.  The risotto, again not a big fan, but I came to a self imposed forced stop due only to concerns for my waist line. The glazed carrots were lovely in flavor, yet slightly too soft for my personal taste. Still delicious.  The lasagna others had looked great and I could see no one was complaining. The wait staff was friendly, I was barely in the door when someone showed me to a table.  Our group did wait a bit for our dinners, but there was over 20 of us altogether and the food turned out to be totally worth any small delay.  The atmosphere reminded me of stepping into an Italian restaurant in some bigger cities 'Little Italy."  It was dark, felt a bit old and 'family'...knowwhatI'm talkin about?  Don't let one off night of service someone else had rob you of a great food experience. Or just go for the dessert.

data.title: Very nice restaurant
data.text:
First time at Rubinos. Food was good. We had a variety of dishes, Spaghetti, ravioli, scampi and chicken piccata. All meals come with soup or salad. Very good house dressing.
Restaurant was clean, nicely decorated as in the old days of Italian. Nice soft music in the back ground. Wine selection limited and pricey. Meals were substantial and filling. Prices somewhat higher for pasta dishes than expected. Waitstaff very friendly and efficient. Service appeared a little slow which I attributed to the kitchen staff. Overall, a good experience, will return.

data.title: Great Italian Food
data.text: Along with friends, we were first time customers.  We were greeted immediately and shown to a booth. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere, clean and well furnished. Our waitress was a very nice young lady named Katlain or "Kat" as she is called. Her bus-boy was at out table immediately with water, bread and dipping oil. The menu is extensive with Italian, American and Seafood selections. Our selections were varied, Veal, Seafood & Italian dishes. We topped off our meal with a reasonably priced bottle of Cab and a delicious desert.  We will return.

data.title: TERRIBLE SERVICE
data.text: We went to this place after purchasing a Groupon since we've never been there. We walked in and stood in the waiting area for 15 minutes before they would even acknowledge us. Another group had reservations and he approached them 3 separate times and his response was basically don't bother me I'm busy and you'll just have to wait. We waited a little longer and walked around and saw 7 open tables. We asked if we could be seated and he said you can sit at the bar and have a water. At that point our party of 3 left and 8 more people also. I have no idea how the food was but based upon their lack of customer service I have very low expectations. If they don't want to provide service they should find a new career.

data.title: Good Food and Atmosphere
data.text: We stopped here for dinner.  It was not very busy at 5:00, but the food was delicious and the service was outstanding.  The salad was crisp and fresh, the Petrale of Sole and pasta was very delicious.  The atmosphere was quiet, with soft music where you can talk and hear each other.  It was very enjoyable.

data.title: Superverb dining experience.
data.text: to begin with the roasted garlic salad dressing prepared by Jessie the chef is outstanding. The appetizers are delicious plus all menu items are individually prepared by the experienced restaurant chef,  good size servings. The lunch prices are very affordable.  The wine selection is ample and they also serve local wines for the surrounding area.  All in all is a great place to visit for lunch or dinner. You wont be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent Food and Outstanding Service
data.text: This restaurant serves great food that was fresh and rich in flavor.  This was my first time at this upscale Italian Ristorante and I have to say that the service was outstanding.  If you visit ask for Katie's section and enjoy your beverages and meal.

data.title: Great dinner
data.text: My wife and I eat here frequently because the food is scrumptious, the service fantastic and the prices reasonable.  We love the chipotle Polenta and between that and the soup or salad that comes with the meal we usually take more than half the entree and side home.  Their Risotto tastes great as does the gnocchi.  The manager, Chris is very friendly and accommodating.  A wonderful non chain Italian restaurant.

data.title: Family or Friends, Enjoy the Evening!
data.text: Sorry for the length of this review, but we felt it deserved the  recognition for both single dining and to go dining. We were planning a dinner party and thought we should try Rubino's before attempting service for 10.  We came for lunch and ordered from the dinner menu to try some of the items. We started with the soup, and the minestrone soup consisted of fresh vegetable, beans, and small amount of pasta items. It was great. The salad had a great light vinaigrette that was just the right amount for the amount of lettuce and other items. Next we ordered 1 serving of veal picatta with garlic mash potatoes, and glazed carrots. The veal came with two perfectly sized pieces of thinly sliced veal that was very lightly breaded, with a sauce that exceeded our expectations. Great combination of what seemed to be butter, white wine, lemon juice and capers and plenty of it.  The mashed potatoes, just as expected, subtle hint of garlic and tasty creamy mash of potato. The glazed carrots, tasted as though they came right from the garden, large and sweet along with a sweet butter sauce that worked well with the rest of the items. The other serving was of the chicken picatta with risotto and glazed carrots.  It seemed as though it was a split chicken breast, breaded lightly, and served with the same great sauce as on the veal. The risotto was prepared just as we like it, dry with just enough moistness to hold it together in its "cupped" form.  The desserts, limoncello cake and tiramisu were the hit of our meal. We really enjoyed this meal so much, we ordered from the to go menu and served 10 with chicken picatta,  garlic mashed potatoes, glazed carrots, and a smaller portion of a mix of the limoncello cakes and tiramisu. Great job by the folks in the kitchen on both meals.

data.title: Italian Food
data.text: Good selection of Italian food that is pleasing to the eye and the stomach.  More of an adult restaurant with white tablecloths and more formal vs casual .

data.title: Beautiful restaurant!!! Food is excellent!
data.text: Menu has choice of dishes with veal, chicken, seafood, beef, pasta dishes & steaks. These all come with choice of side & vegetables and soup or salad. They also have 1-3 special dishes each evening to choose from. Excellent choice of luscious desserts!

data.title: Best birthday ever
data.text: I got to celebrate my 60th birthday at Rubino's. It was a surprise and when I walked in it was magical. It was so comfortable and welcoming The food and service were amazing. They accommodated our large group with ease in our own area where you could table hop and visit with everyone. I have been there many times for romantic dinners and dinners with friends. It is by far my favorite restaurant. The risotto balls are a must have.

data.title: Client
data.text: Good atmosphere, great food and excellent service. One of best italian restaurant in the area. The wine list is exceptional. The best kept secret in placer county. If you  are  in rocklin, ca stop and enjoy some delicious food.

data.title: Our favorite Italian restaurant
data.text: We always have great service and food.  My sister always wants to go to Rubino's when she visits.  Our favorites are the chicken marsala and raviolis.

data.title: Very Good Food
data.text: We always make sure to stay overnight here in Rocklin so that we can have dinner at this restaurant.  Never have been disappointed with the food or the service.  Their Italian dinners are exceptional.  Whatever you try, you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Third and last visit.
data.text:
I really tried to give Rubino's another try and must write this review to remind myself not to come here again (and to warn others what to expect). Each time we have visited, service was extremely slow and not worth the wait based on food quality.  Our first two visits, we just figured it was a busy night or some extra large party overwhelmed the kitchen. I think the servers are overwhelmed, I think they have intentions to deliver good service but they can't do that without adequate support of the restaurant management. 
Our past experiences included :  waiting  15 + minutes before someone acknowledges you to take your order.  Appetizers come with your dinner or your side doesn't come with your dinner.  Really?  Wouldn't the server know that as they bring you your dinner plate- that visit the server had to ask someone.  

The food is okay but it's not worth dealing  with all the poor restaurant management problems. It's too bad because i was really hoping to find a great neighborhood Italian restaurant to visit.

data.title: Lovely Family Restaurant
data.text: This restaurant was nice with excellent wait staff and very good food. It was quiet, clean, and easy to find.  There was a fair selection of traditional Italian dishes and everything tasted great.

data.title: First time here, didn't meet expectations
data.text: Four of us  went to Rabino's for dinner for the first time and were a bit disappointed after hearing good things for many years. First impression was the decor needed to be lightened and updated, it seemed "oldish" and quite dark; I guess good for romance though. However, the primarily problem was the food was just food. In other words, middle of the road, not bad, but nothing to write home about, especially for the price. The chef just didn't develop great flavors. The meats (steaks) and pastas lacked that wake up your taste buds quality. We assume the spices used just didn't hit the mark. Service was good and attentive, Anyway, as Emeril would say they need to kick it up a notch to get the wow factor. By the way, dessert was excellent, great presentation and taste!

data.title: Poor Excuse for Food
data.text: My friend and I ate dinner here on July 3rd 2015. The atmosphere is adequate. The food is cafeteria style at best. My friend had the sole which was suppose to be fresh but had a very odd taste. I had the meat cannelloni and it had absolutely no taste. The carrots were served sliced in a ceramic bowl and tasted awful. Actually the only good part of the meal was the bread and the brockley. The waitress was nice but the food is just not worth the money and I will not be going back to this restaurant. My recommendation is just don't waste your time or money on this place.
